oai_dc:dc.dc:title: From E-2g to other modes: Effects of pressure on electron-phonon interaction in MgB2
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: SINGH, PP
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: superconducting transition-temperature
linear-response theory
magnesium diboride
dependence
lithium
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: We study the effects of pressure on the electron-phonon interaction in MgB2 using density-functional-based methods. Our results show that the superconductivity in MgB2 vanishes by 100 GPa, and then reappears at higher pressures. In particular, we find a superconducting transition temperature T-c approximate to 2 K for mu(*)=0.1 at a pressure of 137 GPa.
